Information, Communication, Knowledge .A Ziman, J.M. At the British Association meeting in Exeter last month, Professor Ziman addressed the section devoted to general topics on the question of how scientific information becomes public knowledge. The system of communication, he implied, is not as rotten as some like to think. .X 29	1	1084 35	1	1084 42	1	1084 43	1	1084 58	1	1084 59	1	1084 70	1	1084 84	1	1084 119	1	1084 161	1	1084 164	1	1084 172	1	1084 191	1	1084 194	1	1084 212	1	1084 214	1	1084 241	1	1084 274	2	1084 324	1	1084 359	1	1084 382	1	1084 401	1	1084 408	1	1084 417	1	1084 441	1	1084 444	1	1084 445	1	1084 446	1	1084 447	1	1084 449	1	1084 458	1	1084 474	1	1084 485	1	1084 486	1	1084 487	1	1084 532	1	1084 572	1	1084 573	1	1084 577	1	1084 579	1	1084 615	1	1084 625	1	1084 640	1	1084 660	1	1084 755	1	1084 762	1	1084 764	1	1084 765	1	1084 778	1	1084 893	1	1084 902	1	1084 916	1	1084 936	1	1084 966	1	1084 986	1	1084 1012	1	1084 1016	3	1084 1030	1	1084 1033	1	1084 1045	1	1084 1084	11	1084 1085	1	1084 1195	1	1084 1201	2	1084 1235	1	1084 1255	1	1084 1274	1	1084 1279	1	1084 1281	1	1084 1285	2	1084 1298	1	1084 1387	1	1084 1387	1	1084
